docs.lead_paragraph: In the epic battle of man versus machine, machines have a growing price advantage.
docs.abstract: A look at how costs for workers and capital have changed in the last two years, and how those changes may have affected businesses’ hiring and investment decisions.

headline.main: The Case of the Mystery Study

docs.lead_paragraph: So Joe Lieberman is proposing that we raise the Medicare eligibility age. That’s a truly cruel idea; as it happens, I know several people who are hanging on, postponing needed medical care, hoping that they can make it to 65 before something terrible happens. And if I know such people in my fairly sheltered social circles, just imagine how widespread such stories must be.

headline.main: Joe Lieberman’s Plan to Make Health Care Worse and More Expensive

docs.lead_paragraph: Like most apartment hunters, Steven M. Goldman knew he was going to have to do some homework on the building he chose.

headline.main: Big Deal | An Update on the Apthorp

docs.abstract: With finances stabilizing at the elegant but troubled Renaissance Revival Apthrop, buyers are taking a closer look. The fashion designer Alber Elbaz decided recently to buy a condo there.

docs.lead_paragraph: Muddy Waters Research Is a Thorn to Some Chinese Companies  |  Carson C. Block, the founder of the investment firm Muddy Waters Research, issued a warning to investors enamored with Chinese companies: buyer beware.
“I have three rules. Don’t walk into a courtroom without a lawyer. Don’t go on a date without Viagra. And never settle an insurance case without Littman.”

headline.main: After the Fire: Do Not Touch Anything

docs.abstract: “Touch the wrong thing, and the policy could be null and void,” explains the insurance adjuster. “Let the experts come and take pictures and do their investigation before you move a single salt shaker.” When will we reopen? Who knows?
